Package chess

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • chess.Board
  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    The Board class is where the logic of the game is handled. It also initiates all the pieces. It checks all the cases in which a proposed move may not be valid
    Author:
    Ansh Shah, Kandarp Patel

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Board()
      Constructor - Initializes all the pieces with their initial positions - Initializes the whiteLayout and blackLayout arrays - Calls the drawInitBoard method

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      boolean canAttack​(char player, int row, int col)
      This method checks if any of the opposition's pieces can attack a given position.
      void captured​(java.lang.String s)
      This method is called when a piece is captured.
      int colIndex​(char col)
      This method is used to calculate the index value from a letter array
      void draw()
      Draws the board by getting the locations of the pieces from the pieces array
      void drawInitBoard()
      Draws the board initially when all the pieces are in their initial positions and initializes the pieces array
      boolean isBlocked​(int fromRow, int fromCol, int toRow, int toCol)
      This method checks if a path from a given location to the target location is blocked by a piece
      boolean isCheck​(int fromRow, int fromCol, int toRow, int toCol, char player)
      This method checks if moving the king will cause that king to be under check from opposition
      void move​(java.lang.String input)
      This method handles the actual moving of the piece.
      boolean pawnAttack​(int fromRow, int fromCol, int toRow, int toCol, char player)
      This method figures out if the pawn is trying to attack and if it is a valid move
      boolean pieceMoveValid​(int fromRow, int fromCol, int toRow, int toCol)
      This method finds out which piece the player wants to move and if the proposed move is valid for that piece
      boolean validMove​(char player, java.lang.String input)
      This method takes into account all the factors that may make the proposed move by the player invalid.

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Board

        public Board()
        Constructor - Initializes all the pieces with their initial positions - Initializes the whiteLayout and blackLayout arrays - Calls the drawInitBoard method

    • Method Detail

      • draw

        public void draw()
        Draws the board by getting the locations of the pieces from the pieces array

      • drawInitBoard

        public void drawInitBoard()
        Draws the board initially when all the pieces are in their initial positions and initializes the pieces array

      • validMove

        public boolean validMove​(char player,
                         java.lang.String input)
        This method takes into account all the factors that may make the proposed move by the player invalid. It calls various other helper methods that look at different factors.
        Parameters:
        player - Which player's move it is
        input - What was the player's input
        Returns:
        boolean This returns true if the player's proposed input is valid

      • pieceMoveValid

        public boolean pieceMoveValid​(int fromRow,
                              int fromCol,
                              int toRow,
                              int toCol)
        This method finds out which piece the player wants to move and if the proposed move is valid for that piece
        Parameters:
        fromRow - The index of the current row
        fromCol - The index of the current column
        toRow - The index of the target row
        toCol - The index of the target column
        Returns:
        boolean This returns true if the proposed move is valid for the piece the player wants to move

      • isCheck

        public boolean isCheck​(int fromRow,
                       int fromCol,
                       int toRow,
                       int toCol,
                       char player)
        This method checks if moving the king will cause that king to be under check from opposition
        Parameters:
        fromRow - The index of the current row
        fromCol - The index of the current column
        toRow - The index of the target row
        toCol - The index of the target column
        player - Which player's move it is
        Returns:
        boolean This returns true if the proposed move on the king will cause that king to be under check

      • canAttack

        public boolean canAttack​(char player,
                         int row,
                         int col)
        This method checks if any of the opposition's pieces can attack a given position. This method is used to check if moving the king will cause it to be under check
        Parameters:
        player - The opposition of the player who's move it is
        row - Index of the target row
        col - Index of the target column
        Returns:
        boolean This returns true if any of the opposing player's pieces can attack the given location

      • isBlocked

        public boolean isBlocked​(int fromRow,
                         int fromCol,
                         int toRow,
                         int toCol)
        This method checks if a path from a given location to the target location is blocked by a piece
        Parameters:
        fromRow - Index of current row
        fromCol - Index of current column
        toRow - Index of target row
        toCol - Index of target column
        Returns:
        boolean This returns true if a path from the current location to the target location is blocked

      • pawnAttack

        public boolean pawnAttack​(int fromRow,
                          int fromCol,
                          int toRow,
                          int toCol,
                          char player)
        This method figures out if the pawn is trying to attack and if it is a valid move
        Parameters:
        fromRow - Index of the current row
        fromCol - Index of the current column
        toRow - Index of the target row
        toCol - Index of the target column
        player - Which player's turn it is
        Returns:
        This returns true if the pawn is trying to attack a piece and if it is a valid move

      • move

        public void move​(java.lang.String input)
        This method handles the actual moving of the piece. It alters the arrays accordingly. It also checks if moving a piece captures an opposing piece and calls the captured method. Then it checks if the move causes the opposition to be under check.
        Parameters:
        input - The input from the user

      • captured

        public void captured​(java.lang.String s)
        This method is called when a piece is captured. It changes the isAlive field of the captured piece and changes the blackLayout/whiteLayout array accordingly
        Parameters:
        s - The string of the piece that is captured from the pieces array

      • colIndex

        public int colIndex​(char col)
        This method is used to calculate the index value from a letter array
        Parameters:
        col - Which letter column the player wants to alter
        Returns:
        int The index equivalent of that letter
